Sequence Information.Peptide Name: EeCentrocin 1 (natural AMPs; common sea urchin, Echinoidea, marine animals, XXA, XXH, two-chains, UCSS2a)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Chain A (shown) is connected with chain B (DIGKYCGYAHALN, amidated) via a disulfide bond. Trp is bromated at position 6 (6-bromotryptophan).Sequence analysis:APD analysis reveals that the sequence of chain A shows 45% similarity toCentrocin 2.Activity: the heavy chain is responsible for antibacterial activity as the light chain (B) was inactive (MIC > 100 uM). Active against planktonic C. glutamicum (MIC 0.78 uM), S. aureus (MIC 0.78 uM), E. coli #1 (MIC 0.1 uM), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.78 uM). Updated 7/2021; 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: Solstad RG, Li C, Isaksson J, Johansen J, Svenson J, Stensv√•g K, Haug T.2016
Literature Information.Title: Novel Antimicrobial Peptides EeCentrocins 1, 2 and EeStrongylocin 2 from the Edible Sea Urchin Echinus esculentus Have 6-Br-Trp Post-Translational Modifications.
